ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: I would be willing to talk about my personal problems if I thought it might help me or a member of my family.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I am always curious about the reasons people behave as they do.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I think that most people who are mentally ill have something physically wrong with their brain. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: When I have a problem, if I talk about it with a friend, I feel a lot better.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Often I don't know what I'm feeling. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am willing to change old habits to try a new way of doing things.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: There are certain problems which I could not discuss outside my immediate family. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I often find myself thinking about what made me act in a certain way.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Emotional problems can sometimes make you physically sick.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: When you have problems, talking about them with other people just make them worse. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Usually, if I feel an emotion, I can identify it.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: If a friend gave me advice about how to do something, I'd try it out.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I am annoyed by someone, whether he is a doctor or not, who wants to know about my personal problems. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I find that once I develop a habit, that it is hard to change, even if I know there is another way of doing things that might be better. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I think that people who are mentally ill often have problems which began in their childhood.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Letting off steam by talking to someone about your problems often makes you feel a lot better.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: People sometimes say that I act as if I'm having a certain emotion (anger for example) when I am unaware of it. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I get annoyed when people give me advice about changing the way I do things. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: It would not be difficult for me to talk about personal problems with people such as doctors and clergymen.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: If a good friend of mine suddenly started to insult me, my first reaction might be to try to understand why he was so angry.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I think that when a person has crazy thoughts, it is often because he is very anxious and upset.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I've never found that talking to other people about my worries helps much.  (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Often, even though I know that I'm having an emotion, I don't know what it is. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I like to do things the way I've done them in the past. I don't like to try to change my behavior much. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: There are some things in my life that I would not discuss with anyone. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Understanding the reasons you have deep down for acting in certain ways is important.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: At work, if someone suggested a different way of doing a job that might be better, I'd give it a try.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I've found that when I talk about my problems to someone else, I come up with ways to solve them that I hadn't thought of before.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I am sensitive to the changes in my own feelings.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: When I learn a new way of doing something, I like to try it out to see if it would work better than what I had been doing before.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: It is important to be open and honest when you talk about your troubles with someone you trust.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I really enjoy trying to figure other people out.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I think that most people with mental problems have probably received some kind of injury to their head. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Talking about your worries to another person helps you to understand your problems better.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I'm usually in touch with my feelings.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I like to try new things, even if it involves taking risks.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: It would be very difficult for me to discuss upsetting or embarrassing aspects of my personal life with people even if I trust them. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: If I suddenly lost my temper with someone, without knowing exactly why, my first impulse would be to forget about it. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I think that what a person's environment (family, etc.) is like has little to do with whether he develops mental problems. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: When you have troubles, talking about them to someone else just makes you more confused. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I frequently don't want to delve too deeply into what I'm feeling. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I don't like doing things if there is a chance that they won't work out. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I think that no matter how hard you try, you'll never really understand what makes people tick. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Mostly disagree; 3= Mostly agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I think that what goes on deep down in a person's mind is important in determining whether he will have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Fear of embarrassment or failure doesn't stop me from trying something new.
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Mostly agree; 3= Mostly disagree; 4= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: PMS Total Score
PMS - Willingnes to try to understand oneself and others subscore
PMS - Openness to new ideas and capacity to change subscore
Notes: Sum of items 12, 26, 27, 30, 31

ElementDescription: PMS - Access to feelings subscore
Notes: Sum of items 5, 11, 17, 23, 35

ElementDescription: PMS - Belief in the benefits of discussing one's own problems subscore
Notes: Sum  of items 4, 28, 34

ElementDescription: PMS - Interest in meaning and motivation of own and others' behavior
Notes: Sum of items 2, 8, 9, 29
